intro: Linanthus dichotomus var. meridianus, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and slopes. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The Sierra daisy is adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions of California and Nevada.
